newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on interbank and retail interest, dealers said on Thursday.

"The interbank rate rose slightly today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were slightly higher but bond prices were narrowly mixed. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 0.85/0.80 percent compared with Wednesday's yield of 0.60/0.55 percent and one-year at a yield of 1.45/1.40 percent against 1.33/1.28 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$98.92/98.97 from Wednesday's close of S$98.05/98.10, September 2001 at S$97.85/97.90 versus 98.05/98.10 and June 2003 at S$95.85/95.90 against S$96.05/96.10.
The overnight interbank offered rate rose to 1-3/8 1-1/4 percent from 7/8 3/4 percent.
